title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 November 2016 - XWiki
content: has quit 01:38  has quit 01:55  has joined #xwiki 02:45  has quit 03:00  has joined #xwiki 03:06  has quit 03:21  has joined #xwiki 03:34  has quit 06:40  has joined #xwiki 07:13  has quit 08:47  has joined #xwiki 09:19  has joined #xwiki 09:39  has joined #xwiki 09:48  has joined #xwiki 10:14  hi there, I have an issue : I'm using services.localization.render("welcome", ["bla","blou"])  , and a welcome key contains some text with {0} and {1} . The problem is {1} isn't evaluated and returned literally ? 10:14  (but {0} is ok) 10:15  tmortagne, would you have a clue ? 10:16  martinus\_\_: what exactly is the string ? 10:17  tmortagne the string is defined in a document as :  welcome=Welcome to the OW2 Community! Your e-mail address is now validated and you can log in to the OW2 sites. Don't forget to download your membership agreement at {1}. 10:17  martinus\_\_: try doubling the ' 10:18  the one in "Don't" 10:18  tmortagne, wow that was it 10:18  ' is an escaping character parameterized translations 10:19  tmortagne, can you tell me where is the documentation about that ? 10:19  and yes it's pretty weird to have ' escaping {1} while being that far to it but that's the way MessageTool is working... 10:19  messagetool ok 10:20  not so sure it's well documented 10:20  well, yes indeed it weird :D thanks for the help tmortagne 10:21  has joined #xwiki 10:28  martinus\_\_: I found a reference to MessageTool documentation in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Localization/#HFeatures but syntax would probably deserve a section of its own (even if it duplicate part of MessageTool documentation) 10:29  tmortagne, I see. Thanks a lot 11:14  sorry, we cannot preview our changes on the SSX 11:23  has joined #xwiki 11:25  has joined #xwiki 12:21  tmortagne, now I'm trying to use url = xwiki.getURL("XWiki.XWikiLogin", "login") to generate a link that I could put in [[Link Name>>url]]  . But getURL() doesn't return the http:// part that I don't want to hardcode 12:25  Or I would been force to use 12:25  [[Link Name>>path:$xwiki.getURL("XWiki.XWikiLogin", "login")]] 12:26  if you are using xwiki/2.1 syntax 12:26  "path:" pretty much much "don't bother and just put whatever I set in href attribute" 12:26  martinus\_\_: 12:27  tmortagne, thanks ! 12:28  I now understand the part in xwiki syntax  "Relative path reference on the server in the form path: (relPath)" 13:44  has quit 13:44  has joined #xwiki 13:45  has quit 13:46  has joined #xwiki 16:27  has quit 17:13  has joined #xwiki 18:20  has quit 18:33  has quit 19:13  has quit 19:16  has joined #xwiki 19:21  has quit 20:09  has quit 20:35  has quit 20:38  has quit
